Class DBOccasionalConnection

java.lang.Object
dbLogic.systemLogin.DBOccasionalConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILoginDatabase
public class DBOccasionalConnection extends Object implements ILoginDatabase
The DBOccasionalConnection class manages the data access logic for Guest (Occasional) customers. It implements the ILoginDatabase interface to provide authentication and registration services.

  • Method Details

    • verifyOccasional

      public int verifyOccasional(String username, String contact)
      Verifies the credentials of an occasional customer and retrieves their user ID.

      This method performs a JOIN operation between the occasional_customer and user tables. It checks if the provided username matches and if the provided contact information corresponds to either the phone number or the email stored in the system.

      Specified by:
      verifyOccasional in interface ILoginDatabase
      Parameters:
      username - The unique username of the occasional customer.
      contact - The contact information provided, which can be either a phone number or an email address.
      Returns:
      The unique user_id associated with the customer if found; returns -1 if no matching record exists or if a database error occurs.

    • resetUsername

      public String resetUsername(String contact, String newUsername)
      Resets the username for an occasional customer identified by their contact information.

      This method follows a three-step validation and update process:

      1. Identification: Retrieves the internal user ID using the provided phone number or email from the user table.
      2. Uniqueness Check: Verifies that the proposed new username is not already assigned to another record in the occasional_customer table.
      3. Execution: Updates the username field for the corresponding user ID.

      Parameters:
      contact - The phone number or email address used to locate the user's record.
      newUsername - The new username to be assigned to the customer.
      Returns:
      A status message: "RESET_USERNAME_SUCCESS" if the update was successful, or a descriptive error message starting with "ERROR:" if identification failed, the username is taken, or a database error occurred.

    • registerNewOccasional

      public String registerNewOccasional(String username, String contact)
      Registers a new occasional customer by creating a user profile and linking it to a username.

      This method follows a strict four-phase transactional process:

      1. Validation: Ensures both the username and contact information (phone or email) do not already exist in the database.
      2. User Creation: Inserts the contact info into the user table. It automatically detects if the contact string is an email (contains '@') or a phone number.
      3. Linkage: Maps the newly generated user ID to the provided username in the occasional_customer table.
      4. Finalization: Commits the transaction if all steps succeed, or performs a rollback if any error occurs.

      Parameters:
      username - The unique username for the new occasional customer.
      contact - The contact info, which can be either a phone number or an email address.
      Returns:
      A String indicating the result: "REGISTRATION_SUCCESS" on success, or an "ERROR: ..." message explaining the failure (e.g., duplicate data or DB error).

    • registerOccasional

      public boolean registerOccasional(String username, String phone, String email)
      Registers an occasional customer by selecting an available contact method and invoking the internal registration process.

      This method determines which contact information to use by prioritizing the phone number. If the phone number is null or empty, it defaults to the email address. The selected contact is then passed to registerNewOccasional(String, String).

      Specified by:
      registerOccasional in interface ILoginDatabase
      Parameters:
      username - The unique username for the new occasional customer.
      phone - The phone number provided by the customer (can be null or empty).
      email - The email address provided by the customer (fallback if phone is unavailable).
      Returns:
      true if the registration was successful; false if it failed (e.g., username already exists or database error).

    • verifySubscriber

      public int verifySubscriber(long subID)
      Verifies a subscriber's identity based on their unique subscriber ID.

      Note: This specific implementation does not support subscriber verification. It serves as a placeholder or a restricted version of the login process, consistently returning a failure code.

      Specified by:
      verifySubscriber in interface ILoginDatabase
      Parameters:
      subID - The unique long integer identifying the subscriber.
      Returns:
      Always returns -1 to indicate that subscriber verification is not supported in this context.
